passage_text: Launched in spring 2010, Sledgehammer produces big, bold red wines. The inaugural releases Cabernet Sauvignon and Zinfandel are made from grapes grown in California’s North coast winegrowing region. We extend hang time to develop riper flavors and age the wines for two years in toasted oak barrels for added complexity.

The bottle is an unmistakable California Cab, dark and red in color with juicy berry notes, it falls short in flavor and mouth feel. Dare I say, it doesn’t taste big enough. The Sledgehammer Cabernet Sauvignon is still a fine bottle of wine, especially considering its price around $12. It’s just that where the Sledgehammer Zinfandel is an unbelievable value for the taste, the Cab is just a good value. Sledgehammer 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon. Score: 85/100. Description: A almost big enough

Sledgehammer Forged Red is for the man who prefers drinking good wine more than talking about it. It’s wine that does not beg to be analyzed or over-thought. Simply put, it’s a blend of red wines that tastes good. It enhances good meat and good times. [qa_link].
